column4: hey guys I'm trying to create a system link of a script to my /usr/bin so that I can execute it by just calling 'myscript', I did sudo ln -s trace.py /usr/bin/trace
but it doesn't seem to work
when I cat the script, /usr/bin/trace, it's empty
do you want a better way to do it or do you want to figure out what you are doing wrong?
well both if it's not a bother?
basically I don't want to have a copy of the script
because it's a check out of a repository
you want to do 'ln -s TARGET NAME' where TARGET = the path to trace.py and NAME = /usr/local/bin/target
I'm doing that, unless target must be an absolute path
it can be relative, but it has to be in relation to /usr/local/bin/
so I can't just do trace.py just because it's in the curdir
